title: SnapSync pipeline halting on RocksDB Busy exception during flat db heal
body:

### Description
During snap-sync, especially on a low IO instance, a deadlock can occur that will halt the snap sync pipeline.  See stack trace in logs below.

Besu should implement a retry policy that will catch the exception and retry the commit before throwing, rather than allowing the exception to abend the pipeline.

### Acceptance Criteria
* Snap sync pipeline is more tolerant of IO saturated machines

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. start snap sync of mainnet with flat db healing, on an IO restricted instance

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
snap sync to finish with full flat db heal

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
When IO contention is too high, a RocksDB Busy exception will be thrown and abend the sync pipeline

**Frequency:** [What percentage of the time does it occur?]

### Versions (Add all that apply)

* Cloud VM, type, size: Azure d4s

### Additional Information (Add any of the following or anything else that may be relevant)

* System info - IO constrained
